intro: Silene thomsonii, commonly known as Thomson's campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink or white flowers and slender stems. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in dense clusters. Silene thomsonii is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environments and is a popular subject in botanical studies.
